intro: Collaea insignis, commonly known as the silverleaf flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and slender, erect stems. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and subalpine regions. Collaea insignis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has limited use in traditional Māori medicine.
